(hue, saturation, value) colorspace is a model to represent the colorspace similar to the RGB color model. Since the hue channel models the color type, it is very useful in image processing tasks that need to segment objects based on its color. Variation of the saturation goes from unsaturated to represent shades of gray and fully saturated (no white component). Value channel describes the brightness or the intensity of the color.
